Name: Dinomals
Description:
Dinomals: the action packed, mix and match, create a creature card game made by kids for kids!

Your goal: make a Dinomal!

Dinomals are half dinosaur and half modern day animal. Get the right dinosaur card and animal card and smush them together to make your Dinomal before your opponents. You can also mess with your opponents hand to stop them from building a Dinomal with SLAM cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: SMART Microgrid Card Game
Description:
In an effort to explain what the Smart Microgrid Applied Research Team (SMART group) does at the British Columbia Institute of Technology, Alan Stewart designed the SMART Microgrid Card Game.  It's a fast, easy-to-play "competition" to see who can manage their RESEARCH in order to be the first to build their Microgrid technologies in all three categories: GRID, ENERGY, and PEOPLE, all while trying to deal with DELAYs played by their opponent.

In gamer terms, it's an anti-deck-building fighting game.

Name: Cat and Mice: Cheesepyramid Traps
Description:
A group of mice must navigate a giant pyramid of cheese, racing each other to see who can collect the most before reaching the top. Mice can wiggle through the holes in the cheese to collect even more, but watch out for the cat!

Having found a lot of holes  in the cheese, the pussy howls: “Mice must feel too much at ease, eating up the master’s cheese. I will guard it night and day,  shooing naughty mice away!” Careful, mice - the cat is sly,  it will hit you – you will fly. Go running to the top! Keep  the cheese and do not stop! Traps are no threat with cheese, win, do not be scared of these!

GAME COMPONENTS: 
Cheese pyramid – 1,  
‘cheese lumps’ 
with holes – 4, 
 numbered tokens – 25, 
 chips:  wooden mouse — 4,  
wooden cat — 1;  
glass balls – 4, 
dice – 1, 
 rules —  1.

THE PURPOSE OF THE GAME:
To be first to reach the cheese pyramid, and gain as many points as possible!

THE PROGRESS OF THE GAME
 •  The game participants take turns to throw the dice and move the mice game pieces towards the top of the cheese pyramid along the tiers (levels). • The game pieces may only be moved anti-clockwise.    • The movement to each subsequent tier (level) is via four staircases. • Only one game piece may be located in the field. Game pieces may “step over” each other. If the relevant field is  occupied by another game piece, the player should go to  the free field ahead of it.  • On the fields with symbols the players must comply with their conditions (see the playing field symbols). • When moving or “stepping” with a game piece over other game pieces the players must hold the marble with a finger of only one hand.

PLAYING FIELD SYMBOLS 
1.  The mouse game piece stopped in the field with this symbol: • If the player does not have the “holes” of his/her piece of cheese closed, he/she will take one token from the bank, and cover the holes with it blindfold, i. e., without turning the token with the number upwards. • If all the holes are already covered with tokens, the player will make an additional move. 
2.  The cat game piece has stopped on this field, so the move is to be made to the player who is next in turn. • If the player’s game piece gets onto the field with the cat’s symbol, the player will throw the dice and move the cat’s game piece by the number of points shown on the dice.  See special cases that may occur during the cat’s movement  in VI and VII. 
3. If the game piece gets into this field, the marble will fall into the hole and roll down to the other tier (level).  The player will move the mouse game piece to a new field, cover the marble with it again, and take two tokens from the bank and cover the “holes” on the cheese piece with them.  See special cases in IV and V. NOTE. The trap field will be inactive if all five holes on the cheese piece are closed with tokens. In this case the player will put the mouse game piece near the hole, so as prevent the marble from falling. 
4. On the upper tier the Players’ game pieces will be moving in a circle until one of them (or the cat game piece) stands precisely on the field with a red flag — the finish field. NOTE. For the smallest kids the game may be finished when the first player reaches or crosses the field with the flag. • Then the players turn their cheese pieces upside down and count the points on the tokens. The one who gains most points will be the winner.  • In the event of two players with equal number of points the one who has reached the finish or is closer to the same will win.

Developing game "Cat and Mouse" in the form of a dimensional pyramid develops fine motor skills, memory and attention. Gives an idea of â€‹â€‹numbers and scoring. Trains accurate eye. Unique 3D form of the pyramid allows you to play not only in one-dimensional plane but in three-dimensional space.
—description from the publisher

The object of the game is to be the first to get your mouse to the top of the pyramid while avoiding the cat.

Each player controls a wooden mouse covering a marble. Players take turns rolling the die and moving their mouse. Some spots allow the marble to drop, requiring the player to move their mouse to that lower location. Other spots trigger the cat to move.
—user summary

Name: Peninsula: North Korea Crisis
Description:
Peninsula is a 2-player asymmetrical strategy card game capturing the tension of the 2017 North Korea Crisis. One player controls North Korea, the other the United States. As the crisis unfolds, players will try to use a combination of diplomacy and military posturing in a bid to claim victory without the situation devolving into a conflict that could leave both sides in ruins.

Players attempt to reduce their opponent's resolve and control regional tension by playing diplomacy and progress cards. When tension rises above certain levels, players receive more progress cards and the crisis develops, yet these cards are the most powerful way to reduce opposition resolve. Each decision could have far-reaching consequences and the challenge is to claim victory in the crisis without both sides destroying each other.

—description from the designer

Name: Android: Netrunner – Sovereign Sight
Description:
Everything that was old is new again. Sovereign Sight is the first Data Pack from the "Kitara Cycle" for Android: Netrunner, and its sixty cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) transport the game's Corps and Runners to the shores of Lake Victoria, where the nations of the Sub-Saharan League are gambling everything on their ability to create a second beanstalk.

The first Data Pack to release following the 2017 rotation, Sovereign Sight sets the course for the new Android: Netrunner metagame, focusing on bluffs, gambits, and tense interactions between Corp and Runner.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Teseu
Description:
Teseu is a boardgame made almost of MDF: markers, meeples, cards and board. The players move their heroes, the common enemy on the game and the board itself.

It is a game where you are a Greek mythology hero in a quest to win a challenge: be the first hero to defeat the minotaur inside a mobile labyrinth, inspirited in the myth of Teseu and the Cretan Labyrinth. The game objective is enter in the labyrinth's centre without being captured by the minotaur, pick up the Artefact that will give the power to unlock one of the dagger replicas that Teseu used to kill the minotaur. With the possession of the Artefact, return to the labyrinth, without be captured by the minotaur and then, exchange the Artefact for one of the Teseu's Dagger. Equip the dagger and enter the labyrinth again to find the minotaur and then defeat him.

In your turn, the player need make 2 actions: (1) move your hero through the labyrinth until 3 spaces and (2) use the amphora's power (a Gods' magic artefacts) that can help you to move more easy on the path or make your foe's path more difficult. At the beginning of each round, each player buy a MDF card (in amphora format). In the game, exist 6 cards and this cards give 4 different powers:

- Run: your hero can move more 1D6 spaces on the board;
- Move adjacent wall: your hero can move one labyrinth's door, in the adjacent wall. The door move 1D6 spaces on the board and before the dice roll, you need to choose the direction which the wall will move;
- Move non-adjacent wall: your hero can move one labyrinth door, in the non-adjacent wall. This door move 1D6 spaces on the board and  before the dice roll, you need to choose the direction which the wall will move;
- Move the Minotaur: the Gods allow you to influence the Minotaur and you must move it 1D6 spaces through the labyrinth.

If Minotaur find an hero and enter in the same space, two possible events happen: (1) if your hero don't have the dagger, the Minotaur send him to the other side of the labyrinth and the outer level and the hero need start again your path. At the encounter moment, the hero need to leave the Artefact, if it has it.  (2) If your hero have the dagger, you defeat the Minotaur and you are the winner.

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – A Phantom of Truth: Mythos Pack
Description:
Where do you go for answers when your world is tilting into madness? The answer: Paris. A Phantom of Truth is the third Mythos Pack in The Path to Carcosa cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game. As you investigate the mysteries behind The King in Yellow, the Mythos Pack's new scenario introduces a new set of clues, along with supernatural terrors that play upon your growing Doubt or Conviction. Amid these horrors, you'll find twenty-two new player cards (two copies each of eleven different cards) to help you stay grounded and pursue the truth.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Path to Carcosa
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Journey to Oldtown
Description:
Journey to Oldtown, like The Archmaester's Key before it, focuses on amplifying the major themes of the fourth cycle in A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. While it continues to follow the major events of A Feast for Crows, this cycle brings new strength to the bestow keyword and provides incentives for the factions to forge alliances and band together. Along the way, you'll encounter a host of iconic characters and locations entering the game, including The House of Black and White, Thoros of Myr, a new version of Arianne Martell, and a lord of House Botley, Tris Botley.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ascension: Theme Pack – Portals
Description:
This digital exclusive is now available in the physical game! Portals act as in-game accelerants: when you pay the Rune cost of the Portal, you begin drawing cards from the center deck until you draw a Hero or Construct that is within two Runes of the Portal's cost. For example, if you purchase a 4-cost Portal, it could quickly turn into a 6-cost Emri, One with the Void.

This pack includes:

Four 2-cost Portals
    Four 3-cost Portals
    Four 4-cost Portals

Portals are a great way to generate fun, memorable moments when you're playing with your friends and family.

—description from the publisher

Name: BuddySays: The Bla-Bla-Blaa Card Game
Description:
BuddySays is a friendship-provoking game- A simple, fun and easy to play the game; BuddySays focuses on trolling, pranking and social interaction as its themes.

Designed with 2 Gameplay modes; Core and Alternate - BuddySays uses the point system to determine the winner. Integrating mobile phone; specifically on making calls as the main method in Core Mode, while playing with other players on the table in Alternate; - making BuddySays a potential super fun and engaging party game.

Get your buddies to say weird stuff with BuddySays. Made for people who are in a relationship with their mobile phones. And trolling buddies.

—description from the designer

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Flight of the Stormcaller
Description: Contains 20 cards to swap with specific cards from Flight of the Stormcaller Adventure pack encounter deck to raise the difficulty of that scenario to nightmare difficulty.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Thing in the Depths
Description: Contains 20 cards to swap with specific cards from The Thing in the Depths Adventure pack encounter deck to raise the difficulty of that scenario to nightmare difficulty.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Temple of the Deceived
Description: Contains 20 cards to swap with specific cards from Temple of the Deceived Adventure pack encounter deck to raise the difficulty of that scenario to nightmare difficulty.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Attack on Dol Guldur
Description: In Attack on Dol Guldur, players join the host of Lórien in a direct attack against Sauron’s Mirkwood stronghold taken straight from the appendix for The Return of the King. This unique scenario can be played by 1-4 players in Standard Game Mode or 3-12 players in Epic Multiplayer Mode. Only one copy of Attack on Dol Guldur is required to play Standard Game Mode, while three copies are required for Epic Multiplayer Mode. The scenario includes two double-sided setup cards, one for each mode, that players use to play the game in the desired fashion.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Superfight: PAX West 2017 Promo Pack
Description: This is a set of nine cards for Superfight that was released at PAX West 2017. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.

Name: Bushido: Itsunagi Ito
Description: Ito Itsunagi is the eldest of the heirs to the Ito clan. His training has been second to none and his skill at arms is quite astounding. A brutal and coldblooded killer, his only downfall is his arrogance, mocking opponents with his lack of armour.

Name: Bushido: Sakura
Description: A priestess of Orochi, she has dedicated her life to the snake kami and has been favoured by beginning the transformation. With the merest of looks Sakura can corrupt a man, turning the blood running through his veins into poison.

Name: Bushido: Akimoto
Description: How the transformation will take hold no one can be sure, Akimoto is taking on the very image of Orochi. In the heat of the battle his allies claim he transforms further, this claim is supported by the opponents that flee in terror in the face of his onslaught.

Name: Bushido: Chiyo
Description: Chiyo has distinguished herself further from her fellow Temple Bushi, she quickly mastered the art of the Asp Strike and her spirit and determination to return to the fray when knocked down has been noted by her superiors.

Name: The Edge: Dawnfall – Abyssal Empress
Description:
Abyssal Empress expansion includes:


     1 Abyssal Empress model
     10 Abyssal Empress action cards
     1 Abyssal Empress squad card
     5 additional scenarios

Name: Kofferpacken extrem
Description: You're going on a trip in Kofferpacken extrem, and you want to pack your suitcase with many things. Who can invent the most creative items with the letters given? And can you remember what everyone else has packed?

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Darnati Warriors – Unit Expansion
Description:
The enigmatic swordsmen of the Latari emerge from the deepest reaches of the Deepwood with the Darnati Warriors Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! These elven warriors turn combat into a deadly dance, using their moonstone blades to slice through enemies with a speed unmatched in Terrinoth. Master the blade and defend the Aymhelin!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Wraiths – Unit Expansion
Description:
Fear is made flesh with the Wraiths Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! With the ability to pass through walls and unleash a shriek to terrify even the most stalwart Daqan warriors, these phantoms torment the armies of the living with an unnatural fury. Unleash the ancient specters and make the living cower before you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Flesh Rippers – Unit Expansion
Description:
The army of the Uthuk Y'llan unleash their fiendish cavalry with the Flesh Rippers Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! These swift creatures rend flesh from bone, smelling the blood in the hearts of their enemies even at great distances. Expand your locust swarm and terrorize Terrinoth!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Outland Scouts – Unit Expansion
Description:
At the farthest reaches of Terrinoth, remote villages find their protectors in the Outland Scouts Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! These inspirational soldiers use their knowledge of the land to outwit invaders and rally the greater Daqan forces with their indomitable faith. Call your banners and defend Terrinoth at all costs!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Berserkers – Unit Expansion
Description:
The infantry of the locust swarm takes to the battle eld with the Berserkers Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! Hailing from the steppes of the Ru Darklands, these howling tribesmen strike fear into their enemies as they attack without reason or mercy. Grow your Uthuk army and bring Terrinoth to its knees!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Kethra A'laak – Hero Expansion
Description:
The most terrifying witch of the blood coven takes her command with the Kethra A'laak Hero Expansion Pack for Runewars Miniatures Game! This sorceress ruthlessly leads the Uthuk Y'llan's forces either astride her loyal flesh ripper or on the front lines among the howling berserkers. Feed you blood lust and conquer the realm for the locust swarm!

—description from the publisher

Name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Spined Threshers – Unit Expansion
Description:
Call forth the greatest demons of the Ynfernael with the Spined Threshers Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! These grotesque monsters raze villages and can tear down castle walls with ease. Destroy your enemies and make mortals tremble with fear before you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Wer war's?
Description:
This learning game consists of cardboard rectangles containing pictures of animals and the traces they leave behind when eating. For example, a slug and a mushroom with bites taken out of it.

There are two sets included:

     one set of two-part black & white cardboard rectangles: one square shows the animal, the other the traces they leave behind when eating
     one set of pairs of colored cardboard squares of just the animals
     one set of pairs of colored cardboard squares of just the traces


The rules describe how to play dominoes with the black & white pieces, and a couple of variations of memory with the colored pieces.

–user summary

Name: シン・関ヶ原 (New: Sekigahara)
Description:
A game covering the Sekigahara campaign all over Japan.

The game system is derived from A Few Acres of Snow by Martin Wallace.
Each player starts the game with their own card deck worth 10VPs.  Each turn, players can purchase new cards worth their current VP total.
Most clans starts the game inactive, and players need to purchase the cards representing them. They also mobilize, move, and attack with cards.
The game lasts 8 turns.  Victory is decided by controlling VP areas or killing the opposing leader.

Unit scale: 2,000-3,000 men per counter
Game period: KeichÅ 5
Counters: 198
Map: A2 (42 x 59.4 cm)
Cards: 32


Published in Game Journal #64.

Name: Ashes Reborn: The Goddess of Ishra
Description:
A new Phoenixborn enters the fray with The Goddess of Ishra expansion deck for Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn! All enemies kneel before Astrea, who provides enlightenment to all who seek her out. Spring into action with this full, ready-to-play deck, or use the cards you find here to build your own deck centered on the Phoenixborn of your choice. The Goddess of Ishra gives you the freedom to find new combinations of cards and unlock new types of decks. With each Ashes expansion deck, you can supplement your collection with new spell and unit cards in order to play out all-new battles!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Ashes – Rise of the Phoenixborn

Name: Ashes Reborn: The Boy Among Wolves
Description:
Wild is the son of the Spiral Jungle. Koji Wolfcub walks boldly into your games of Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn in The Boy Among Wolves expansion deck. The jungle itself rises up to help him in his fight to restore the world. Bring his power to the table in this ready-to-play expansion deck or use the cards you find here to customize your own deck.

In addition to Koji Wolfcub, The Boy Among Wolves includes new spells, units, and conjurations that give you the freedom to create your own combinations of cards and explore the world of Ashes like never before!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Ashes – Rise of the Phoenixborn

Name: Star Wars: Armada – Chimaera Expansion Pack
Description:
Grand Admiral Thrawn arrives to the battles of Star Wars: Armada in the Chimaera Expansion Pack. Along with the chance to command your fleet with this brilliant, blue-skinned Chiss tactician, the Chimaera Expansion Pack introduces an Imperial Star Destroyer adorned with a distinctive chimaera design, two Mandalorian Gauntlet squadrons, six ship cards, and seventeen other upgrades. Altogether, these materials don't just give your Star Destroyer a different aesthetic; they allow it to fill entirely new tactical and strategic roles within your Imperial fleet.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Armada – Profundity Expansion Pack
Description:
With its powerful ship and cunning commander, the Profundity Expansion Pack for Star Wars: Armada lends new hope to the rag-tag Rebel fleet. Its miniature pre-painted MC75 star cruiser boasts an impressive array of weapons, armor, and shields, and it comes with two ship cards and fourteen upgrades that feature Admiral Raddus, Jyn Erso, and other notable characters from Rogue One. Together, these crew members and the Profundity Title upgrade allow you to make a wide range of clever adjustments to your overall strategy.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Alpha-Class Star Wing Expansion Pack
Description:
The first widely deployed Imperial star fighter to boast shields and a hyperdrive, the Alpha-class Star Wing had limited maneuverability, but was heavily armed for its size. The fighter remains impressively durable and destructive in Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game, where its two agility, four hull, and three shields are paired with the ability to unleash cascading torrents of missile and cannon fire. The Star Wing's pre-painted miniature in Alpha-Class Star Wing Expansion Pack is accompanied by four ship cards, seven upgrades, one maneuver dial, reference cards for the reload action and jam tokens, and all the plastic and tokens you need to fly the ship to battle.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – M12-L Kimogila Fighter Expansion Pack
Description:
Produced by MandalMotors and flown by enforcers of the Hutt kajidics and other criminal cartels, the M12-L Kimogila Fighter was dreaded by spacers across the Outer Rim for its ordnance capacity and the withering torrents of coordinated fire it could unleash. The M12-L Kimogila Fighter Expansion Pack brings this heavy fighter to life in Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game as a blunt instrument that trades maneuverability for raw destructive power. Its pre-painted miniature star fighter comes with four ship cards and ten upgrades, many of which reward you for catching your foes in the ship's new bullseye firing arc.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Phantom II Expansion Pack
Description:
The Phantom II is a Sheathipede-class transport shuttle that the Spectres recovered from a Clone Wars-era military base and modified with weapons and a custom docking system. It makes its Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game debut in the Phantom II Expansion Pack as an attack-ready vessel that comes with four ship cards and six upgrades. These include new astromechs, crew upgrades, and Title upgrades that incorporate more of Star Wars Rebels in your space battles and add depth to the shuttle's ability to perform the coordinate action.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Fruit Ninja: Card Master
Description:
Fruit Ninja: Card Master is a fast-paced deck building game that allows 2 to 4 players to compete and prove their wit and dexterity. As ninja apprentices, they need to master their arts and prove to Sensei who is the most worthy trainee.

The game takes place over four rounds in which each player has to play their 15-card deck in a real-time match-making showdown. After each battle, players have a chance to upgrade their cards and improve their deck!

—description from the publisher

A Kickstarter campaign was initiated for a series of 3 games based on the popular app game. Having not met the expected goals, the campaign was terminated. From the 3 games announced, only 1 made it to print: Fruit Ninja: Combo Party.

Name: Centauri Saga: Arena
Description:
This expansion works perfectly well with Core (not Centauri Saga: Abandoned)

The expansion adds 2 more players so now you can play the scenarios with 5 and 6 players.

The Arena expansion introduce four(4) competitive scenarios Player vs Player  and one (1) new Co-op Scenario (Reaching for the stars).
—description from the publisher

Name: Zumbis!
Description:
On these comic-book-game you are the hero (or the zombie).
Each frame has options to go further in history as a survivor in an zombie outbreak trying to survive and scape the city But if you like you can play as an infected zombie trying to eat and scape the city.
Although the main objective for both characters are the same, the gameplay and the possibilities for each as unique, flowing through the book.
2 Game-books in one.

Name: Johnny Staccato
Description:
Board game based on the 1959 / 1960 U.S. TV Detective series.

From the instructions:

Johnny Staccato, a piano player at Waldo's Club is also a private eye with 6 special cases on his books which involve :-
Murder / Arson / Blackmail / False Pretences / Burglary / Hit and Run Road Accident.
He enlists the aid of his friends, each choosing a case to solve. A friendly rivalry exists between them as they each endeavour to collect a set of clues that will solve a case.

OBJECT OF THE GAME:

The object of the game is to be the first to collect a complete set of 8 cards of one particular series which will show the complete crime from start to finish. The first player to do so is the winner.

Name: Black Lion's Roar: The Battle of Cantigny, May 27-31, 1918
Description:
During their Spring offensive, the German 82nd Reserve Division captured the crucial crossroads town of Catigny. The newly arrived 1st US Infantry Division was rushed to the front and its 28th Regiment, nicknamed the Black Lions, was ordered to retake and hold the town. Although the Americans quickly took the town from the disorganized and ill-prepared defenders, the Black Lions had to then endure days of increasingly desperate and violent counter-attacks that decimated the ranks of both sides. The outcome of the battle would be a telling indicator of America’s new role in the Great War.
—description from the publisher

Name: Café Express
Description:
In a wild west were adventurers, outlaws and citizens are addicted and powered by coffee, a devastating plague threatens to end once and for all the storages of the precious black gold. Now, the last 3 beans are traveling in a reinforced train in order to be planted in a safe soil, but not without dragging the attention of everybody across the railroad.

In this 2 / 4 players game, you must fight as an Authority or an Outlaw to keep or steal the last 3 fertile coffee beans in the State.

Each character has its own set of actions printed in transparent cards, which are inserted in a bigger card with the opponent's actions as well, creating the base game cards. Then, each player must chose a card and play it at the same time. The person with the initiative executes his or her action first, then the other does this as well. After that, cards are swapped. It means the Authority's card goes to the Outlaw and vice-versa.

The Outlaw must then use these actions to move alongside the train to steal the beans before it arrives its destination, and, off course, without losing all his or her health points. Meanwhile, the Authority must keep at least one bean until the final station. The time track advances everytime the cards are swapped out.

Fight to save, or maybe even steal, the last hope of this coffee-driven civilization in this quick and strategic game by Potato Cat.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blackwood: Viking
Description:
A promo card of a viking visiting the village of Blackwood.

You can play the viking like a Potion card. If you  give him 2 four-leaf clover, you will win 6 coins and the viking will return in the North Sea.

Name: The Scroll
Description:
The Scroll is a deck building game where players compete against each others, and against the game itself. Players incarnate heroes with unique abilities, expanding the powers on their quest to collect the Tears of Power - the artefacts needed for the ritual summoning the Scroll - and become the ruler of the Sacred Lands."

Each player starts the game with a hero (with unique powers to use through the game), a starting deck of crystals (the in-game currency), and a secret quest. Each hero has also a specific thematic and colour, corresponding to the type of crystals they use.

Four card stacks - one for each corresponding crystal colour - are used to get new cards. Players start only buying cards from their own crystal colour, until they gain new abilities allowing them to get cards associated with the other crystals.

To win the game, two Tears of Power must be collected. One is obtained by accomplishing the quest (requires a deck optimisation); the other is obtained by successfully summoning Rhaluyne the Wise (requires enough crystals and a dice roll).

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Westhope
Description:
In the near future, humanity suffers an existential threat in the form of a highly negative first contact with an alien race. The result is the Seeding – an alien invasion, but not a normal one. The invasion comes not in high-tech assault, but in a massive injection of foreign species, many only semi-intelligent.

Westhope centers around the actions of eight main characters who, through your actions, attempt to survive and resist.

Westhope is not simply a board game. It is a cluster of multiple games containing a common core mechanic called the Plan. For example, during a period the characters may be attempting to search for refugees over a wide area. They play a Journey mission. They search, evade or face enemies, working to survive while journeying over a large area. The next mission may be penetrating a facility, and they instead play a Tactical mission, where play style is more tactical RPG game with the Plan at its core. During Interludes, a specialized form of choose-your-own-adventure sets the characters and their allies on different paths, and pulls you into their lives so that they are far more than simply stats.

Westhope will have nearly every style of play available. Its core is an ambitious campaign where you truly begin to empathize with the characters and their allies (and enemies). However, players can engage in separate solo, cooperative, or competitive modes in each of the individual board game elements.

The campaign spans months and years, and expansions continue the story, some adding new board game methods to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pfau ziehen
Description:
Pfau ziehen is a simple tug-of-war game to lure peafowl using a sealed auction bid. 
The theme is based on a word play, because the German words for rope (Tau) and peafowl (Pfau) rhyme.

Players simultaniously play cards. The player with the highest card may pull the peafowl one step towards his goal. Tied players are ignored.
The first player to move the peafwol to his goal wins.

Name: Monopoly Junior: Bakugan Battle Brawlers
Description:
This appears to be one of several unlicensed themed versions of Monopoly Junior originating in China. Although Uncle Pennybags appears on the Monopoly Junior logo and (incongruously) on some game spaces and cards, there are no publisher logos or other crediting.

It seems there exist at least five cover variations: two with the Bakugan logo under the Monopoly logo ringed by characters, one of them with a flat Monopoly logo and one with a more elaborate fake-3D one; one with the Bakugan logo in the bottom left and three foreground characters; and two with the Bakugan logo at the bottom flanked by two foreground characters, one with English text and one with a Romanian flag and text.

The gameplay is identical to regular Monopoly Junior, with a nearly complete lack of player decisions. Players roll and move along the board, automatically purchasing visited properties, drawing chance cards, and performing monetary transactions until someone runs out of money. Properties are a selection of characters and other features from the Bakugan franchise.

Name: Tank Girl Super Game
Description:
Let Tank Girl and the gang help you as you try to collect as much gold as possible before time runs out!

The Tank Girl Super Game is a traditional board game in which Tank Girl and friends help you to collect as much gold as possible before time runs out. Includes an A4 card playing board, four coloured counters, thirteen illustrated game cards, cut-out Gold tokens, a mini die, and game instructions.

Name: Genies
Description: Genies is a bidding game about the world´s most famous scientists. Each player tries to hire scientists in his academy to score in three rankings in eight different disciplines. Therefore the players have to simultaneously make secret offers for five scientists each round. After each second round, there is a new ranking. Action cards can give the players special incentives concerning the profile of their academy. After the third ranking the player who has scored the most points in all rankings combined wins the game.

Name: Halt!
Description:
The players start at "Start". The first to reach the parking lot wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. At certain spaces, traffic related events hinder or help the players, as described in the game rules. The game is designed to teach children about traffic signs.

The older Liliput editions show the traffic signs from 1927. In 1934 the game was updated to the new traffic signs. Some of these are pictured with the old arrows still around them, being a combination of old and new.

Name: Achtung! "S-Kurve": Großes Motorrad-Rennen
Description:
The game is for 2 players or 2 teams of players. Movement is determined by 3 dice with the numbers 1 to 5. On 2 dice, the 6th side is blank (stud). On the 3rd die, the 6th side is red (called gas station attendant). Each player or team has 5 motorcycles and 5 numbered race tracks. If it's track number is rolled the motorcycle advances 1 space. If the player rolls red, he may move any motorcycle 4 spaces; if all 3 dice show the same number, the motorcycle on the track of this number is moved 4 spaces. The gas stations count for 4 spaces. Each motorcycle arriving at the finish line gets a set number of points, depending on the order of arrival. The player or team with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Fotosafari
Description: The board has a square grid on the four sides, numbers 2 to 12. In the middle, 10 wooden trees are randomly placed and, at random, one pawn per player. Then each player rolls two dice, sums them up and places on one of the four boxed number one of the 10 wooden game animals. At this point you have to move the animal with the result of either of the two dice. With the other die you can do one of the following: cancel it and do nothing; move his pawn orthogonally, in the desired direction; move another animal already on the board, in the direction of the head. At the end of these movements, if the pawn of the turn player is orthogonally within 4 boxes from an animal (or even more than one) without the line of sight being obstructed, he can "snap a photo" by picking the corresponding card from the deck . The first one who manages to collect ten photos of the ten different animals won the game.

Name: To Berlin
Description:
English board game from WWI.  No rules available or any information about how many players or how the players advance (dice or spinner).  Also the squares have different elements (solid red, red cross, and star) that have some kind of game play aspect.

Board says it is part of "Valentine's Series"

Name: Ideal Map of Muckden Battlefield
Description: Odd game regarding the battle of Muckden. No rules or units exist as far as I know but the map speaks of reserve placement, cavalry, cossacks, railroads, cavalry charges and shots. Towns are noted by numbers and there are names of key General and towns.

Name: La Guerre Moderne
Description: This is a huge watercolor point to point board game of French battles in WWI that was drawn in 1915.  It does not have a title but the internet says its "La Guerre Moderne".  The internet also said it was published in 1914 but you can see on the bottom Série 1915 (Series 1915).  There appears to be an artist's name in the bottom left corner but it is not readable.

Name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Swayed by the Dark Side
Description:
"You're Black Krrsantan. The infamous Wookiee bounty hunter. I've heard of you. I know why you were forced to leave Kashyyyk. And how you've disgraced your people ever since."
     —Obi-Wan Kenobi to Black Krrsantan

Swayed by the Dark Side is the fourth Force Pack in the Alliances cycle for Star Wars™: The Card Game. Its sixty new cards (divided between two copies each of five different objective sets), continue to explore the bonds of friendship, duty, and honor that drive many of the galaxy's pilots and soldiers, as well as the fear, hope, and greed that compel others to take action.

Among these new objective sets, you'll find new units and tactics for the Sith, Imperials, Scum, Jedi, and Rebels. You'll find cards to carry you from the Imperial strongholds of the Core Worlds to the forested moons of the Outer Rim. You'll find new enhancements, events, and Fate cards that support decks built around multiple affiliations. And you'll find a number of recognizable, high-impact characters taken straight from the films and Marvel comics, including Biggs Darklighter, the Ewok Logray, and the notorious Wookiee bounty hunter Black Krrsantan!

—description from the publisher

Contains objective sets 275-279
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Star Wars – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: NeoParadise: Rampage
Description:
NeoParadise: Rampage is a card game set in a science fiction, dark fantasy, post-apocalyptic world where 4 factions slaughter each other for "survival".

Main Features

     The 4 groups have different play styles but that's not all. Each faction either adds or changes a rule of the game to their advantage, but that's not all! Each faction also possess a different resource system!
     How to win, during the match players will play buildings (one of the 3 card types) to form their "base". This constructions can be damaged and the moment your enemy has no more of them in the field, you win.
     We have 2 ways of playing, one in which you play with your deck in 1 pile, and another in which you separate your deck in 2 piles. You can choose from which pile you draw your card each turn. This decreases luck and increases strategy.


Comments from the designer:

A big part of the game is that all factions are broken and fragile at the same time. All of them can win or lose against all of the others in a ridiculous way, specially when you get the hang of it.

In this game we have 3 card types, Units, Buildings and Interventions. Units represent your "troops", Buildings make your base and Interventions are standalone effects. You can't cancel enemy effects in this game, only normal attacks from 
Units.

While it's not difficult to learn, specially if you have played other card games, the fact that every faction is so different might make you feel you are learning 4 games at the same time...Might.

Also, when it comes to playing times, the one registered is the standard. But sometimes, specially when you really grasp the game and you get top level luck: you can get a 3 minute match... This happened only once during testing, quite a funny thing it was. And also, if you have no idea whatsoever and get terrible luck it can stretch up to an hour and a half. Only in those circunstances.

Name: Battle of Bannockburn
Description:
Battle of Bannockburn tries to simulate the battle that faced the English against the Scottish armies in the beginning of the 14th century (1314 A.C.). In this game you have to choose between english army or scottish army. The two players play face to face and both players have the same number of troops: 7 soldiers of infantry, 2 archers, 2 horse knight riders and the King. There are also, reserve forces. Each army has their own characteristics. In this case, the English have more soldiers (as in the real battle) but the Scottish infantry is stronger, so there is a balance. Careful, try not to lose the King. If your King dies you don't lose automatically the match,but you will lose some soldiers of infantry.
The aim of the game is to destroy the enemy army and win the battle for freedom.

—user summary

Name: Welt der Sinne: Hören, Sehen, Schmecken, Riechen, Fühlen
Description:
"Sensory World – hearing, seeing, tasting, smelling, feeling"

Young Native Americans are preparing for their first sense-awareness trial. Sipokoo, the wise owl, guides the young Natives in mastering a wide variety of tasks, sharpening their senses. Where exactly is the bell? What figures can you identify with only your fingers? Which two bags are equally heavy? The game box includes everything you need for the basic games exploring hearing, seeing and feeling. Later on, household items can supplement the games related to smelling and tasting.

The basic game comprises 6 beginner’s trials for hearing, seeing and feeling.

Tasting and smelling games are added for advanced play variations.

Expert-level games challenge true nature scouts.

"Sensory World" contains overall 16 different games.

Name: Ill-Tempered Tikis
Description:
The natural forces in the South Pacific are out of alignment. The balance of power between the Tiki gods is in chaotic disorder. The Tiki families are at war with one another. Be the first player to collect a complete family (5 different Tikis of a single color) and bring peace and harmony back to the South Pacific.

You will have a three card hand. Each turn you will draw one card then play 1 card. The cards on the table in front of you are referred to as your tiki family.  At the beginning of the game there are no cards in front of you so your first 5 turns are spent building your family.  They do not need to match to have them in your tiki family. You just can't win until you have 5 different tikis with the same color.

Name: The Appalachian Trail Game: The ME-GA Expansion Set
Description:
We are excited to announce NEW cards that expand the game play of both the Backpacking and the Special Edition of The Appalachian Trail Game. The ME-GA Expansion Set includes two distinct decks -- The Thru-Hiker Deck and the A.T. Communities Deck. These two decks combine for 25O new cards and mirror the dual backpacking experience of spending time in the backcountry and in A.T. Communities along the way.

To play with the ME-GA Expansion Set...


     Replace your old Challenge Cards with NEW Challenge cards from the ME-GA Expansion Set 
     Shuffle the NEW Chance cards in with your existing Chance cards 
     Get your GA-ME on!


—description from the publisher

Name: Mobius Corpse
Description:
A creative word and writing game inspired by Exquisite Corpse,  and somewhat similar to Eat Poop You Cat, but with creative writing as the underpinnings instead.

Each player writes a story fragment of some agreed-to size. They can either agree to a specific theme, voice, or tense, or they can have no such agreement at all. Then one player, known as the moderator, tells each player who to send his story fragment to. Each player will send his fragment to two different players, one with the subject "first" and the other with the subject "last". After a player receives a "first" and a "last" from other players, he must write a transition that connects the two story fragments together. The completed work is sent back to the moderator with the subject "transition", and the moderator puts together the complete story, linking fragment to transition to fragment to transition, and so on. The result is a story that loops, and is usually quite disconnected.

Name: Monopoly: Belkin
Description:
Belkin offers a diverse product mix that provides people with seamless electronics integration in their homes, cars, and on the go. Founded in California in 1983, Belkin is a privately held company and the recognized leader in connectivity solutions, in addition to accessories for MP3 devices, computers, and more. We provide extensive solutions for networking, home theater with our PureAV" line of cables, power, and digital wireless accessories and many more categories. You can view and purchase them at www.belkin.com, as well as through network of major distributors, resellers, and superstores.

Belkin's phenomenal growth has led to our expanding global presence, which is why we thought Belkin was a great fit for a Monopoly game. We hope your family and friends will enjoy buying, selling and trading Belkin locations worldwide while pursuing the dream of owning it all. What a better way to visit all of our offices than through the exciting game of Monopoly!

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: University of Washington
Description:
Go Huskies TM!

Monopoly, the legendary game of property and money, and the University of Washington, the celebrated university of academics and research, team up to create a classic board game for Husky M fans everywhere. Take a spin around the bdard to find the best loved buildings and scenes of one oRAntErRa's great universities. And be prepared to pay big bucks if you and Denny Hall or en Library the first building on campus and the campus' main library doesn't come cheap!

Grab your friends and family, put on your Husky M sweatshirt and enter the halls of UW for the game of your life. The Hub, Red Square, McMahon Hall, Burke Museum or 22 other UW properties can all be yours. Whether a student, alumnus or fan, can you resist the chance to buy Washington's finest?

GAME INCLUDES Game Board. Property Cards. Play Money and Banker's Tray. 2 Dice. 10 Game Tokens. Chance Cards. Community Chest. Cards. Package of Dormitories. Package of Houses.

Photography courtesy of University of Washington Athletics Media Relations and University Photography. Center Board Photo by Loyd C. Heath.
—description from the publisher

Name: Beatdown: Streets of Justice
Description:
"Plan your combo. Save the city together. — A fun, cooperative, strategic crime-fighting card game."

Beatdown is a 1-4 player fully cooperative card game. Players team up to defeat waves of comic-book criminal and eventually go toe-to-toe with a crime-boss that threatens their city. The group wins if they are able to reach and defeat the boss and lose if all players are simultaneously reduced to 0 hitpoints.

The core fighting mechanic revolves around building combos by using a mixture of attack cards in hand and from the shared "Attack" deck. Between each attack players must roll a 10-sided combo die to see if they can continue their attack. Each added attack increases the difficulty rating of this roll. A failed combo roll leaves an opening for enemies to attack.

At the start of the game each player chooses a hero with a unique stat-line and ability. Heroes tend to have roles for group play such as tanky wrestlers or fragile high-damage boxers. Planning the right team to bring can be crucial for defeating the foes that await.
—description from the publisher

Name: Battalions
Description:
Battalions is a card game for 2-4 players which uses two packs of 52 standard playing cards.

The game is played over a series of rounds in which players are trying to manoeuvre cards from a battalion pool in front of them and in to their hand (deployment). When any player has succeeded in deploying 5 cards (i.e. have 5 cards in their hand) the game ends and the players go to war. The cards are counted and scored and the player with the highest total has defeated the other players and won the game (War).

—description from the publisher

Name: Tokyo Ghoul: The Card Game
Description:
Tokyo Ghoul: The Card Game: a strategic, turn-based deck building card game for 2 to 4 players. Using allies with different skills and abilities, players struggle to become the top ghoul in a deadly turf war. Combining well known deck building with direct combat, Tokyo Ghoul: The Card Game encourages thoughtful decision making and carefully planned strategies to win. Tokyo Ghoul: The Card Game is based on the hit anime and manga sensation Tokyo Ghoul, enjoyed by tens of millions of fans worldwide. The game allows players to build a deck of their favorite ghouls in a strategic game of pitched battles where only the strongest will survive. Tokyo Ghoul: The Card Game is sure to be a hit with fans of dark fantasy and Tokyo Ghoul.

—description from the publisher

Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shadows of the Past – Hero Pack: Splinter
Description:
The Splinter Hero Pack allows players to take control of Master Splinter in any scenario and rule the foot with age and experience. Designer Kevin Wilson has brought the sage-like leader of the TMNT from the comic series to the tabletop with four new scenarios of heart-pumping action. The Splinter Hero Pack also features the introduction of the mechanized terrors of the Turtleverse: MOUSERS!

This Hero Pack comes complete with:

     Splinter plastic miniature with a Hero sheet 
     Eight Special move/ability cards
     Three custom dice 



     Plus 15 MOUSER tokens 
     A MOUSER villain sheet
     An Adventure comic with 4 new scenarios
Families: Comic Books: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Name: Bushido: Temple Bushi
Description:
The Temple Bushi are chosen from the ranks of the Ito’s ashigaru for skill and prowess shown on the battlefield. Only the best are selected to guard the temple of Orochi and it is considered a great honour to be chosen.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Ayako Ito
Description:
Many have failed to notice the snake like qualities of Ayako so beguiled by her beauty, the Ito could probably have married into a greater clan before her transformation. A Shisai of the highest order, when she combines strength with her sisters she can become nigh-unstoppable. 
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Satoshi
Description:
He is beast of a man revered by the Ito ashigaru for his size and strength. Some jokingly claim he must have been stolen from the Minimoto, but never within earshot of Satoshi. His sheer determination have seen him survive where others would submit.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Kenzo Ito
Description:
Brave, strong and incredibly mobile Kenzo is the perfect soldier. Orochi’s touch has improved Kenzo’s ability to take the fight to the opponent and he does so with no care for his own safety. He strikes fast and more often than not he strikes first.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Naoko
Description:
Naoko was one of the first to be blessed by Orochi when he was stirred from his slumber by the actions of Itsunagi. No one is sure where the transformation will take her next, but her size and the blinding venom she spits terrifies the hardiest of opponents.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Kazuhiko
Description:
Kazuhiko has taken the first steps to joining the followers of Orochi and he will do whatever it takes to prove his devotion. He gives his all to support those touched by Orochi and ensure their safety.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Takeji
Description:
Takeji is renowned for his bravery and steadfastness; born to a higher status he could have achieved great heights as a samurai. As it is he is an important member of the Ito’s small force of ashigaru, his qualities have however been noted by his superiors.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Kaihime Ito
Description:
Orochi found Kaihime a worthy recipient of her gifts and bestowed upon this deadly samurai archer the means to carry out her will. Her keen eye and swift arm sew dead across the battlefield. Her arrows find their way through even the toughest Minimoto armour and if the cold Ito steel doesn’t finish her unlucky targets, Orochi’s blood soon devourers them from inside, leaving those praying for a swift end.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Masunagi Ito
Description:
Little is known of Itsunagi Ito’s enforcer. The “Red Death” as he is known in Okyo, named so for the mask that never leaves his face. Some whisper that Orochi’s gift has warped and distorted his face. What is clear is that his mind is definitely twisted. The apparent satisfaction he makes from cleaving his foes in half, or the calmness in battle reflects the actions of one who is teetering close to madness. Rumours and conjecture aside what is undisputable is that Masunagi Ito is a fearsome and brutal warrior on the field of battle.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Jade Mamba Guard
Description:
The Shisai and Samurai of the Ito clan feel no fear, even in the heart of enemy territories, when they are escorted by the Jade Mamba Guard. Their loyalty to the rulers of Izu is total and unquestionable. Their number made up of the faithful of Orochi and a strict selection process ensures that only the best remain and are allowed to take on the honor of guarding the Ito elite. Although the training is a closely guarded secret it is whispered that the final test for the recruit is to put his or her hand into a basket containing the deadly Jade Mamba, if the prospect’s loyalty is not total they are bitten and left to die in excruciating agony.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Hitoshi
Description:
A seasoned veteran of many conflicts and a loyal servant of the Ito clan. On the battlefield Hitoshi skilfully wields the sasumata to immobilise his enemies, pinning them to the spot after knocking them from their feet with a deft spin of his pole arm, enabling his comrades to close and finish them with little difficulty. Although the Ito clan were laughed at by other clans for their development and implementation of the sasumata, now in open war many are made to reconsider their opinions as the effectiveness of this unusual weapon cannot be denied. 
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Yatsumata
Description:
It’s unclear if this huge snake is a priestess of Orochi warped by the Kami into its image or simply a monster from the jungles of Shimagamo. In battle Yatsumata moves with frightening speed and direction as if guided by an unseen hand. In combat each head can deliver a muscle wasting venom through foot long fangs as hard as iron, downing even the toughest warriors as they are reduced to a whimpering mess. Two heads leave the unholy beast with few natural blind spots, adding to its already strong survivability and resilience gifted by its speed and thick scales.  
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Saburo
Description:
Orochi’s gift presents differently in all her worthy followers, it might be a reflection of an individual’s persona or of Orochi’s intentions for them, subtly crafting the recipient into a tool in the service of their god. If Saburo were a tool it would be a scalpel, fashioned of Minimoto steel. This cool and calm servant of the Ito was once a temple bushi, and as all who demonstrate their devotion was chosen to receive the gift. The physical training that is integral to the training of the Orochi temple bushi was only further enhanced after his transformation into a hebimiman. Now the frightening warrior of the Ito emerges from the shadows to dispatch the enemies of the Ito, disappearing just as fast leaving his foes shocked and with no target for retaliation.    
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Satsuki
Description:
The strength of sisterhood found in the Shisai of Orochi is not like the standard bonds found in faith. The Shisai of Orochi are spiritually and mentally stronger in the presence of their sisters. Few in the Jwar Isles can challenge the will of two let alone three of these fervent believers in Orochi’s power. Satsuki like the other Shisai lets Orochi’s will flow through her, becoming a channel with which Orochi can strike down its enemies. Those who stand against the Ito shisai fall crumpled to ground, wracked in agony as Orochi’s poison destroys their bodies from the inside, Satsuki’s presence accelerating the process to terrifying speeds, leaving only the faithful to walk in Orochi’s lands.  
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Mizuki Ito
Description:
Another daughter of the Ito clan succumbed to the temptation of Orochi’s Blessing. Once a beautiful child of the Ito, with many a samurai lord interested in claiming her hand for a son. That was all before she started the visions that led her to her one and only partner, for now she is wed to Orochi. The Blessing awakening a deep power within her, granting her the power to grant minor gifts to fellow believers to conduct Orochi’s bidding. Her gaze able to bend the minds of even the most resolute to her own ends or freeze them in place until they might serve a purpose for this deadly and beautiful Shugenja of the Ito.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Shimogama Vipers
Description:
The island of Izu is one of the less habitable places in the whole of the Jwar Isles, bestowed upon the Ito as a slight by the Eagle clan to make it clear to all, including their subordinate clan, who rules. A broken landscape with little arable land for farming, brimming with danger and hazard from the hostile terrain or its inhabitants, beasts unique to the island fill its dense jungles. Beautiful as they are exotic, with colourings to make the royal gardens seem dull in comparison. Amongst the many reptiles lurking in the shadows of the canopy the Shimogama vipers are some of the largest and deadliest. Five foot of muscle, harnessed by great feathery wings enables the snake’s great power and movement, striking without warning and disappearing just as fast. These ancient predators of the jungle are drawn to the service of their mother in times of war.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Yuui Ito
Description:
Another daughter of Orochi, a ferocious warrior gifted with great prowess in battle and the honour of Orochi’s snake form body. She slithers across the battlefield seeking out the cowards in the shadows and dispatching them in Orochi’s name. Although not of the Ito bloodline Yuui has risen amongst the ranks of the followers of Orochi, a rise that has not gone unnoticed by many Ito, who by birth should outrank her. 
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Tamotsu
Description:
Where the Prefecture have embraced the new advancements of gunpowder weapons the Ito have always preferred to concentrate their martial pursuits on the more traditional weaponry, specifically the short bow which their archers wield to great effect. Their archers are swift and deadly in the terrain of Izu, and their slightly smaller bows allow for maximum movement in the jungles. Tamotsu is a gifted scout, trail finder and an integral part of the Ito’s war efforts.      
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Taisei
Description:
Deep in the cold, moist temples to Orochi where the greatest nightmares lurk, Taisei waits, conserving his energy only for the bidding of the one true Kami. His physical prowess making him an impressive specimen of the Hebi, his great strength allowing him to wield the no-dachi with frightening agility, fearsome power or crushing an enemy beneath muscled coils, immobilised and helpless to the mercy of the merciless.              
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Okyo Archer
Description:
The ashigaru in the Okyo garrisons are massing in preparation for the battles to come. Whether armed with the Okyo naginata, a slightly smaller version of the standard weapon due to the confines of the terrain, or the Ito short bow they are ready to combat the enemies of the snake. The versatile archers make excellent skirmishers, lightly passing through the densest undergrowth before raining death upon the enemy with cold Izu steel. 
—description from the publisher

Name: Crime Writers
Description:
Crime Writers is a unique crime game that - besides providing the exciting atmosphere of solving a murder - also challenges the writing skills of the players.
The original black and white photos evoke the mood of classical crime fiction as well as the visuality of suspense and film noir movies. 
The crime element cards are really inspirational without exercising too much influence on the storytelling process.
It is a card-based cooperative creative party game with semi-competitive elements.
It contains 86 cards that represent the five basic elements of a crime story in four stacks of cards: crime scene, killer/victim, motive, cause of death. 
The game has two stages. The first is the writing stage, where everyone writes a story of a crime using the elements from the cards they have drawn.
In the second stage, the player who's turn it is becomes the writer and the others become guests.
The guests try to reveal the crime story by asking and guessing and try to figure out the whole story, observing the rules of asking.
The guests must continue until they can make all the connections and tell the whole story.
The game only comes to an end once the story of every player has been found out.

An exciting card game for any party of teenagers and adults.

Playing Time: 15-20 min./player

—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Child of Orochi
Description:
The Children of Orochi serve in his temples, young Ito pledged to their father, they give everything including their souls to the Great Coiled One, in the hope that he will bestow them with his favour and change their imperfect forms which they are cursed to wear until they proven themselves worthy. So devoted to him that his chosen are able to use their bodies as conduits of his power, further extending his react and the power of Shisai.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Jirou
Description:
The Ito are not known for their courage like the stoic Bear or fearsome Dragon, however that is not to say that their troops are not filled will a sense of pride and purpose when urged on, under the Ito Mon. Jirou flies the standard with honor inspiring his comrades against those who oppose the Snake. 
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Okyo Ashigaru
Description:
Ashigaru are the mainstay of the houses of Jwar, making up the bulk of all the major and minor clans’ military forces. As one would expect they personify the teachings and martial practices of their lords. The Bear are strong and tough, the Dragon, drilled and brave and the Snake cowardly but cunning. Using their numbers to their advantage when fighting as a unit they are a formidable foe.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Kyou
Description:
Whilst the female Shisai perform rituals and tend to Orochi's shrines, the male initiates are the martial arm of the faithful. Instead of blessings of transformation and the ability to channel the Will of Orochi; he has been gifted a serpent companion. Even if Kyou finds himself debilitated his escort fights on unaffected. He also empowers other Shisai around him increasing their commitment to the cause.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Ito Clan Special Card Pack 1
Description:
Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create very a focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are three types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way enables will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event and Terrain Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the factions strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Ito Clan Special Card Pack 2
Description:
Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.
—description from the publisher

Name: 878 Vikings: Event Card Expansion Pack
Description:
This limited edition card pack includes four cards to add to your 878 Vikings experience.

Cards Included: Viking Hero, Battle Frenzy, Viking Ally & Burhs.

These cards were later made available as part of pack from backing Game Boy Geek 2017 Kickstarter campaign

These cards are included in the French, Spanish, German, and Italian versions of the game.

Name: Azul: Joker Tiles
Description: Azul: Joker Tiles is a set of ten promotional tiles that can be used with the Azul base game. Complementing the castle's aesthetics, these special tiles also provide more depth in decision-making as they can serve as a proxy for any of the other tiles. However, their beauty comes at a price as players won't be able to score them for end of game color bonuses!

Name: Spider Island
Description:
BACKSTORY

The notorious flagship - Dead Reckoning - has been scuttled in open water by the Royal Navy. A small crew of cut-throat seadogs has washed ashore on the beaches of an uncharted island...

OBJECT OF THE GAME

The winner is the player that survives the longest.

SURVIVING

To survive, players compete to collect resources and craft them into items to better protect themselves from the threats of the island.

BEWARE OF BITES!

As players collect resources and craft items they’re regularly bitten by spiders. PURPLE, GREY, BLACK and BROWN cubes symbolize venomous spider bites.

When a player receives “bites” she places them on her player board. During play, too many bites incapacitates players. In the final phase, too many bites kills them.

—description from the designer

Name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Golden Age Superman Promo Cards
Description:
From the Golden Age of Comics, this set features 3 Dice Masters cards. An iconic image of Superman throwing a car on Thrown Car, a fanciful portrayal of Mr. Mxyzptlk, and the terrifying Bizarro come to the tabletop. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Thrown Car: Basic Action Card (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men)
    Mr. Mxyzptlk: Golden Age of Superman
    Bizarro: Golden Age of Superman


Thrown Car can be used with any Basic Action Dice, Mr. Mxyzptlk and Bizarro use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest.
